original: Brunius, Gomer Thorstensson, rytt-mästare, verkst. direktör, Göteborg, f. 16/1/09 i Göteborg av konsul T. H. L. B. o. Hildur Nilson. G. 37 m. Sonja A. M. Tell. Barn: Ulrika f. 39, Carl Gomer 40, Thorsten C. H. 42. — Avg:ex. fr. Gbgs hand :inst. 29, kav:isk. 29, vol. å pappersbruk 30. Bitr. konsul: sekr. i New^castle 31, egen imp:- o. affärsfirma 32-34, dir :assist. h. Thorsten Brunius & Co. A-B 35-36, verkst. dir. där samt i agenturaff. As’surans A-B o. i A-B Hunnerstad sed. 36, ordf. i styr. f. Nybo-holms o Qviltlis’ Bruk. Led. av styr. f. Hånsfors Bruks A-B, Gbgs fältritt-kl., Res:off :sällisk. i Gbg. Medl. av Frimurarorden. Gbgs landst:förb. SM.
translated: Brunius, Gomer Thorstensson, cavalry captain, managing director, Gothenburg, b. January 16th, 1909 in Gothenburg to Consul T.H.L.B. and Hildur Nilson. Married in 1937 to Sonja A.M. Tell. Children: Ulrika b. 1939, Carl Gomer b. 1940, Thorsten C.H. b. 1942. Brunius graduated from the Gothenburg School of Business in 1929, from cavalry school in 1929, and in paper manufacturing in 1930. He worked as assistant consul and secretary in Newcastle in 1931, had his own import and business firm from 1932-1934, was assistant managing director at Thorsten Brunius & Co. A-B from 1935-1936, and then managing director there and at the agency firm As’surans A-B and A-B Hunnerstad from 1936 onward. He was chairman of the board for Nybo-holms and Qviltlis’ Bruk, and a member of the board for Hånsfors Bruks A-B, the Gothenburg Equestrian Club, and the Society of Reserve Officers in Gothenburg. He was also a member of the Freemasons and the Gothenburg County Federation.

education.name: Graduate of Gothenburg School of Business

memberOf.name: Society of Reserve Officers in Gothenburg
